Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no Friday the 13th in March 2021, as the 13th falls on a Saturday.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that the next full moon will occur on March 28, which is not within the same week as the time change and Friday the 13th.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only provides a Facebook post and does not provide any additional evidence or sources to back up the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the time change, full moon, and Friday the 13th are happening in the same week of March 2021, which is not accurate.
Exist alternative explanation: The confusion in the claim might come from the fact that in March 2020, these three events did occur within a few days' time frame, suggesting an alternative explanation for the misinformation.
